application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description:
T1	Magnolia. 	Light reduction away from the house and over the drive.	
T2	Cherry 	Prune branches back away from street light. 	
T3 	Yew	Reduce height to level with top of fence 	
T4	Elder (neighbours)	Section fell to as close to ground level as possible	
T5	Sycamore	Section fell to as close to ground level as possible. Poison stump with eco plugs.	(this is causing damp issues with neighbours basement)
T6	Conifer	Section fell to as close to ground level as possible (tree is too large for ths small garden)
T7	Cherry 	Crown Reduction - Reducing the height and spread of the tree by up to 2m and remve deadwood. Also remove small ash stump.
decision_conditions: It is recommended that these trees can be pruned as follows; T1	Magnolia, overall crown reduction by 10% to include reducing the growth over the driveway and away from the property. T2 Cherry to front of property, prune to clear lamp column by 1-1.5m. T3 Yew, reduce to fence level. T4	Elderberry (neighbours) fell to ground level. T5 Sycamore, fell causing damp issues with adjacent property. T6 Conifer fell to ground level (tree is too large for this small garden) T7Cherry 	overall crown reduction by up to 2m.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
